pullRequest.title: Adding the feature to support importing and exporting API Products
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
Support importing and exporting API Products from API Controller
Fixes: wso2/product-apim-tooling#291
Goals
Design and implement the REST APIs and functions in APIM as a feature, to support importing and exporting API Products (along with their dependent APIs) to the APIM. (Mainly this will be used from the API Controller)
Approach

Generated the WSO2 Admin Portal REST API (v1).

Introduced a new scope as apim:api_product_import_export to invoke the above REST APIs. (To use the above resources the user need to have apim:api_product_import_export scope. But note that, to use these resources in the scenarios where the user wants to import/update dependent APIs, the user should have not only the apim:api_product_import_export scope but also should have apim:api_import_export scope as well)
Wrote new functions to import and export API Products in utils.
Restructured the existing functions that have been used when importing and exporting APIs by refactoring the common methods that have been used in both import/export APIs and API Products, by creating appropriate classes.

Refer [APIM] Support for API Products from API Controller for further information.
User stories

Export an API Product with the meta-information, documents, images (thumbnails), client certificates and dependent APIs.
The following main scenarios can be captured by the import API Product functionality.

Import a fresh API Product with a fresh set of dependent APIs*.
Import a fresh API Product when dependent APIs are already imported to APIM successfully and you do not want to update those APIs.
Import a fresh API Product when dependent APIs are already imported to APIM successfully and you want to update those APIs*.
Update the API Product only by changing the meta information and by adding/removing the resources of the API Product.
Update the API Product by adding new resources to both the API Product and the API(s)*.
Update only the dependent APIs*.
Import the API Product and its dependent APIs to another tenant (with isDefaultProviderAllowed=false)
Update only an already imported API Product and but not its dependent APIs in another tenant  (with isDefaultProviderAllowed=false)
Update an already imported API Product and its dependent APIs in another tenant (with isDefaultProviderAllowed=false)



(Note that, the scenarios which contain * mark are not allowed to be performed by a user who has only apim:api_product_import_export scope. The user need to have apim:api_import_export as well to perform those tasks)
Release note
WSO2 Admin REST API supports importing and exporting API Products now.
Documentation
Documentation changes should be done.
